reviews.review_msg: Dave Campbell no longer teaches at SFU. He essentially teaches data science using very step-by-step assignments. He gives you an example, then gives you a question. He shows you the code, what it does and you're ready to do it. Dave has a breadth of thing in this class, APIs, JSON, SQL, R plotting, only class I felt i learnt something practical!

This is by far the most useful class I have taken at sfu, but also very difficult and time consuming. Weekly labs that take a long time to complete, difficult midterm, fair final! But Dave and the Ta's are super nice and helpful, and very smart indeed. This class prepares you for real jobs. Previous coding and statistics skills are REQUIRED or F.
The most useful course I have taken so far. Great pro. Get ready to put effort but you would learn a lot

DO NOT CHOOSE HIM UNLESS YOU WANT TO DROP YOUR GPA. Dave personally is nice and he is glad to answer your questions. However, his marking is the weirdest that i have ever seen at SFU. You have about 10 labs to do and MiD/Final. However, you will not get the marks and ANY feedback for assignments nor final. Then you find a C in your transcript.

Assigned quite a bit of work over the semester but it did a good job bringing you up to speed on a lot of data manipulation/representation techniques. Midterm was somewhat difficult, final was quite fair. Your success in this class depends on how well/quickly you can write R code.

His tests and assignments are fair, and very useful. He gives a lot of opportunities for bonus marks. Most of the class got good marks. He is very smart, and the lectures are very interesting. Great experience with him overall.

He is the best prof at SFU! Without any second thoughts take your classes with him. His tests are extremely fair to the content he teaches. His lectures are very accessible and easy to take notes of. Also, he brings many interesting topics to class for learning that he will not test you on it, making it very enjoyable! Dr. Elliott, you are amazing!
Very caring toward students.  Easily accessible outside class. Genuinely care about students understanding the course content.

Probably the best prof at SFU, all lectures will be recorded, with CC. Every lecture is extremely detailed, if you cant understand the material it is probably your problem. This prof actually cares about his students.
Lloyd is a really good professor he cares about student, hes the best
He is a very good lecturer and gives plenty of time for questions during lectures. Also very approachable and fast at responding to discussions on canvas. Exams were extremely fair.
The labs are really hard and time-consuming. Midterms and finals are in the lab, and it's very stressful.

This is my second time taking a course with Owen, and he's absolutely fantastic. His lectures are clear and easy to follow, and he's incredibly approachable during office hours. While the labs can be on the slightly tougher side, they really help you succeed on the exam if you put in the work. Just ask him during office hours, and you will be ok.

His coded quizzes are too difficult for this class. He packs a lot of topics in and covers all pretty rushed for how in depth each topic is. This also might be a flaw in the STAT240 class as the curriculum is sort of predetermined.
